page.title: 07 NEATH AND TENNANT CANAL.
page.content: The plans for the go-ahead of the{Neath Canal}was given by the Government in{1791}and it was built in {1795}.They built the Neath Canal to carry manufacted goods and coal from the valleys down to Neath.It starts at {Glynneath}and finishes in{Briton Ferry {The Tennant Canal}was built by George Tennant in{1824}and it starts at{Aberdulais}and finishes at{Swansea {Port.}Aberdulais Basin in the Thirties was therefore a very busy place,as both canals met here.The Neath Canal also went over the Neath River here by flowing over an aquaduct. Gradually the mines started to close and by the late 30's the canal and tow paths were overgrown.They stayed that way until the{Neath and Tennant Canal {Preservation Society}was formed in{Aug {1974.}Their work was rewarded in{1979 with the{Prince of Wales Award.
